Text.Value: Then steel your mind and destroy them. Simple.
Good book?
Sounds dangerous. Maybe you should leave it alone.
No, I won't kill them! Well, maybe Gale...

EditorData.NodeContext: The book's telling you to kill your companions. An emphatic no, then considering

Text.Value: No, I won't kill them! Well, maybe Wyll...

EditorData.NodeContext: The book's telling you to kill your companions. An emphatic no, then considering

Text.Value: Although I can't make any progress as long as those spirits remember their mission. It seems to be all they know.
It's powerful magic, not to be toyed with. I could take it off your hands.
I wouldn't be trying to reason with them if 'murder' was an option, would I?

EditorData.NodeContext: rolling your eyes

Text.Value: Just tell me what I need to know. Tell me your secrets.

EditorData.NodeContext: To book

Text.Value: Gale would take it off your hands.
What are you hoping to find in there anyway?
Keep at it. Maybe you'll figure out a way.
I got deep into the pages of this book before they drove me out. And almost drove me mad.
Let. Me. Go! Ah... Hello.

EditorData.AnimationTags: Custom anim: Mirror Book_StruggleShut from FOR_DangerousBook_Tome dialog
EditorData.CinematicNodeContext: Astarion closes the book with great effort
EditorData.NodeContext: You strain against the hands and snap the book shut, at which point the invisible hands vanish and you're free. You notice the player looking at you.

Text.Value: Maybe. Maybe not. It's hard to know what's lurking in here.
No, I won't kill them! Well, maybe Shadowheart...

EditorData.NodeContext: The book's telling you to kill your companions. An emphatic no, then considering

Text.Value: I didn't say anything.
They're too strong for that. They must be hiding something good.
Probably. It's a tome of necromancy, after all.
No, there's something in here. But the voices - the spirits in the book won't let me see it.
I'm not sure. A dance with death, maybe.
Can you summon the dead? Bring them back? Can you - ugh, can you shut up and let me read?

EditorData.NodeContext: 'ugh, can you shut up and let me read?' is said to the book. There are spirits that only Astarion can hear, trying to tempt him.

Text.Value: Come on, come on. What are you hiding?

EditorData.NodeContext: Looking through the book, talking to self/book

Text.Value: I can't risk it. There's something valuable in here.
Indeed. As long as the spirits remember their mission, the book is a lost cause.
As long as those spirits remember their mission, I doubt it. Keeping the book safe is all they know.
Anyway, I'd rather keep it where I can see it. Its time will come, I'm sure.
I barely opened it when they started whispering from the shadows.
What? No - not you.
What in the hells was that?
What secrets?
Stay silent.
But still, we live in hope. Figuratively speaking.
I only read one page before their maddening whispers drove me away.
Thank you, very helpful. But I can't risk it. There's something valuable in here.

EditorData.NodeContext: Deadpan 'thank you, very helpful'.

Text.Value: No! He's not eating this one. It's too valuable.
Still. If nothing else, maybe I can beat Cazador to death with it.
This is a powerful book of necromancy, but it's guarded by spirits.
Yes, best to focus on what's urgent.
No, I won't kill them! Well, maybe the tiefling...

EditorData.NodeContext: The book's telling you to kill your companions. An emphatic no, then considering

Text.Value: It sounds like you need an exorcism.
I mean it plays with your mind. There are secrets here, but the book has spirits. They fight you every step of the way.
Still, I doubt this will help us with our parasites. Maybe it's better to put it aside for now.

EditorData.NodeContext: Puts the book away.

Text.Value: Perhaps. But would that damage the tome itself?
Leave.
A unique read, certainly. A tome of necromancy, guarded by spirits.
Whatever's in here, it might give me an edge over Cazador. Or free me from him entirely.
I could hold on to it if you like?
Forgive me. This book reads you more than you read it.

EditorData.NodeContext: Tired.

Text.Value: Trust me, the spirits won't be any kinder to you. As long as they remember their duty to protect this book, no one's getting in.
I can't. I feel a connection with it, but the spirits within fight me at every step.
No! You're not eating this one. It's too valuable.
Then stop reading it!
And I should rest. This has all been a lot.

EditorData.NodeContext: Weary after mentally battling the spirits in the book.

Text.Value: Need some help?
I don't know. That's the point - they're secret.

EditorData.NodeContext: the player asked a stupid question: "what secrets?"

Text.Value: No - stop it - I won't kill them!

EditorData.NodeContext: To book. stop it = 'stop saying that'

Text.Value: Now every time I open it, the voices surge back into my mind. I can't reason with them - they exist to protect that book.
What? No. I - I'm fine.

EditorData.NodeContext: Realises the player is nearby and talking to him. A little rattled, you've been talking to a haunted book.

Text.Value: Whatever's in here, it might give me an edge over my old master Cazador. Or free me from him entirely.
Of course I'm not. It's just - it gets to you.

EditorData.NodeContext: referring to the book you're holding, and the voices you hear.

Text.Value: I almost reached the end before they drove me out. And drove me all but mad.
I've no idea.
No, I won't kill them! Well, maybe the gith...

EditorData.NodeContext: The book's telling you to kill your companions. An emphatic no, then considering

Text.Value: It's a book of necromancy, full of secrets about controlling the dead, returning the dead to life, and who knows what else.
Give it to me, then.
Generous, but I'd prefer to keep it. It may be rather valuable.
I can't. I won't. Now - stop!

EditorData.CinematicNodeContext: Astarion struggles against invisible spectral hands.
EditorData.NodeContext: Spectral hands start to appear around you, grabbing at you. These hands are invisible to the player, but you can see them. You struggle against them.

Text.Value: Is there anything we can do?
Someone went through a lot of trouble to protect this tome. It has to be something more than a book of cantrips.

EditorData.NodeContext: Cantrips = very minor magical spells.

EditorData.stateContext: Astarion is no longer holding the book - it's safely in his inventory

Text.Value: No! There's something in here - I know it.
You're not killing anyone in this party.
What do you mean?
I was just perusing this little find and - WILL YOU SHUT UP?!

EditorData.AnimationTags: [ChadD] Astarion Slams the open book shut.
EditorData.CinematicNodeContext: Astarion slams the open book shut
EditorData.NodeContext: Starts speaking to the player, but then shouts at the book, which he then slams shut. He's been hearing voices coming out of the book. The player can't hear them.

Synopsis: After giving Astarion the Tome of Thayan Necromancy, he begins to study it at camp to learn its secrets. He's frustrated by the voices of the spirits contained within the book, which are stopping him from accessing the secrets he's sure it contains. If he pushes the spirits too far, they'll respond with force - tearing at him with spectral hands. As you discuss the book with Astarion, his tone is on edge - nearly obsessive about discovering what's in the book. He won't part with it, even if he can't read it right now.
